availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Father of William Yates, John Yates, George Yates, and Joseph Yates. Farmer in Scott County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott, District 2, pp. 470A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott, District 2, p. 649, p. 12 of 26 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott, District 1, p. 938.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott, District 1, p. 222B, p. 18 of 38 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "Joseph Yates (1800-1887)," Memorial #59410575, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59410575 (accessed April 27, 2018).
